http_handlers.name: UpdateBot
http_handlers.description:
Update the configuration of the agent.
Through this API, you can update all agents created through the Cozy platform or API. In addition to updating the agent's name and description, avatar, persona, and response logic and opening remarks via the API, it also supports binding knowledge bases and plugins to the agent.

fields.name: bot_id
fields.description:
The intelligent agent ID to be modified.
Enter the development page of the agent, and the number after the `bot` parameter in the development page URL is the agent ID. For example, `https://www.coze.com/space/341****/bot/73428668*****`, the bot ID is `73428668*****`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Agent's name. Length should be 1~20 characters.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description information of the agent. Length is 0~500 characters. Default is empty.

fields.name: icon_file_id
fields.description:
The file ID of the avatar for the agent.

- If no file ID is specified, the Coze platform will assign a default avatar to the agent.
- To use a custom avatar, you should first upload a local file via the [upload file](https://www.coze.cn/docs/developer_guides/upload_files) API and obtain the file ID from the response of the API.

fields.name: prompt
fields.description: The persona and response logic of the intelligent agent. Length is 0~20,000 characters. Default is empty.

fields.name: prologue
fields.description:
Agent's opening remarks. Length: 0~300 characters. Default: no opening remarks.

If the opening remarks include the user name variable `{{user_name}}`, the business side needs to handle it in the API scenario, such as replacing this variable with the user's name on the business side when displaying the opening remarks.

fields.name: suggested_questions
fields.description: Preset questions for agent's opening remarks. Each question should be 0~50 characters in length, with an unlimited number of questions. No default preset questions.

fields.name: dataset_ids
fields.description:
The knowledge base ID bound to the agent.
In the Button platform, open the specified knowledge base page, and the number after the knowledge parameter in the page URL is the knowledge base ID. For example, https://bots.bytedance.net/space/736142423532160****/knowledge/738509371792341****, the knowledge base ID is 738509371792341****.

fields.name: auto_call
fields.description:
Whether to automatically call the knowledge base. The values include:

- **true: (default) automatically call**. The knowledge base is called in each round of conversation, using the recalled content to assist in generating replies.
- **false: call as needed**. The knowledge base is called based on actual needs, using the recalled content to assist in generating replies. In this case, it is necessary to clearly specify in the persona and reply logic area on the left under what circumstances to call which knowledge base to reply.

fields.name: search_strategy
fields.description:
The search strategy for the knowledge base. Values include:
0: (Default) Semantic search. Understand the relationships between words and sentences like a human does.
1: Hybrid search. Combine the advantages of full-text retrieval and semantic search, and sort the results comprehensively to recall relevant content fragments.
20: Full-text search. Full-text retrieval based on keywords.

type.name: SearchStrategy
type.description:
The search strategy for the knowledge base. Values include:
0: (Default) Semantic search. Understand the relationships between words and sentences like a human does.
1: Hybrid search. Combine the advantages of full-text retrieval and semantic search, and sort the results comprehensively to recall relevant content fragments.
20: Full-text search. Full-text retrieval based on keywords.

fields.name: code
fields.description:
Call status code.

- 0 indicates a successful call.
- Other values indicate a failed call. You can determine the detailed error reason through the msg field.

fields.name: msg
fields.description: Status information. When the API call fails, you can view detailed error information through this field.

http_handlers.name: GetBotOnlineInfo
http_handlers.description:
To get the configuration of a specified agent, the agent must be published to the Agent as API channel.
This API only supports viewing agents that have already been published as API services. For agents that have never been published as API, you can view the list and configuration on the [Coze platform](https://www.coze.com/).

query_params.name: bot_id
query_params.description:
To view the agent ID, go to the agent's development page. The number following the `bot` parameter in the development page URL is the agent ID. For example, in `https://www.coze.cn/space/341****/bot/73428668*****`, the bot ID is `73428668*****`.


Ensure that the space to which the agent belongs has generated an access token.

fields.name: code
fields.description:
Call status codes.

- `0` indicates a successful call.
- Other values indicate a failed call. You can determine the detailed error reason through the `msg` field.

fields.name: msg
fields.description: Call state information. In case of failure, error details will be returned.

fields.name: bot_id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the agent.

fields.name: icon_url
fields.description: Avatar URL of the intelligent agent.

fields.name: create_time
fields.description: Create time, formatted as a 10-digit Unix timestamp, in seconds (s).

fields.name: update_time
fields.description: Update time, formatted as a 10-digit Unix timestamp in seconds (s).

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version number of the latest release of the agent.

fields.name: prompt
fields.description: The persona and response logic of the intelligent agent. Length is 0~20,000 characters. Default is empty.

fields.name: prologue
fields.description:
Opening remarks for agent configuration.

If the opening remarks set a user name variable `{{user_name}}`, the business side needs to handle it by itself in the API scenario, such as replacing this variable with the user name on the business side when displaying the opening remarks.

fields.name: suggested_questions
fields.description: Recommended list of agent configuration questions. This field is not returned when user question suggestions are not enabled.

fields.name: api_info_list
fields.description: Information about the tool list of the plugin.

fields.name: frequency_penalty
fields.description: 频率惩罚 没配置不返回

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: 生成随机性 没配置不返回

fields.name: top_p
fields.description: top p 没配置不返回

fields.name: presence_penalty
fields.description: 存在惩罚 没配置不返回

fields.name: top_k
fields.description: 生成时，采样候选集的大小 没配置不返回

http_handlers.name: GetSpacePublishedBotsList
http_handlers.description: View the list of agents published to the Agent as API channel in the specified space.

query_params.name: space_id
query_params.description: The Space ID of the space where the agent is located. The Space ID is the unique identifier of the space. To enter the specified space, the number following the `space` parameter in the space page URL is the Space ID. For example, `https://www.coze.cn/space/736163827687053****/bot`, the Space ID is `736163827687053****`.

query_params.name: page_index
query_params.description: Page size. The default is 20, meaning 20 data entries are returned per page.

query_params.name: page_size
query_params.description: Page number for pagination. Defaults to 1, which means data is returned starting from the first page.

fields.name: code
fields.description:
Status code.
`0` means the call was successful.

fields.name: msg
fields.description: Status information. Detailed error information can be viewed through this field when an API call fails.

fields.name: space_bots
fields.description: List of agents published to the Agent as API channel in the specified space.

fields.name: bot_id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the agent.

fields.name: publish_time
fields.description: The most recent release time of the agent, formatted as a 10-digit Unixtime timestamp. The list of agents returned by this API is sorted in descending order by this field.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of agents in the agent list.

http_handlers.name: CreateDraftBot
http_handlers.description:
Create a new agent.
After calling this API to create an agent, the agent will be in an unpublished draft state. After creation, you can view the agent in the Coze platform's agent list. Call the [Publish agent as an API service](https://www.coze.com/docs/developer_guides/publish_bot) API to publish the agent as API service, then you can view this agent by calling [Get agent list](https://www.coze.com/docs/developer_guides/published_bots_list) or [Get agent configs](https://www.coze.com/docs/developer_guides/get_metadata) API. 
When creating an agent via the API, you can set the space where the agent is located, the agent's name and description, avatar, personality and reply logic, and opening remarks.

fields.name: space_id
fields.description: The Space ID of the space where the agent is located. The Space ID is the unique identifier of the space. To enter a specified space, the number following the `space` parameter in the space page URL is the Space ID. For example, in `https://www.coze.cn/space/736163827687053****/bot`, the Space ID is `736163827687053****`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the intelligent agent. Length: 1-20 characters.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the agent. Length is 0~500 characters. Default is empty.

fields.name: icon_file_id
fields.description:
As the file ID for the agent avatar:

* If the file ID is not specified, the Coze platform will assign an avatar to the agent by default.
* To use a custom avatar, you should first upload a local file through the [Upload Files](https://www.coze.com/docs/developer_guides/upload_files) interface and obtain the file ID from the interface response.

fields.name: prompt
fields.description: The persona and response logic of the intelligent agent. Length is 0~20,000 characters. Default is empty.

fields.name: prologue
fields.description:
Agent's opening remarks. Length: 0~300 characters. Default: no opening remarks.

If the opening remarks include the user name variable `{{user_name}}`, the business side needs to handle it in the API scenario, such as replacing this variable with the user's name on the business side when displaying the opening remarks.

fields.name: suggested_questions
fields.description: Preset questions for agent's opening remarks. Each question should be 0~50 characters in length, with an unlimited number of questions. No default preset questions.

fields.name: code
fields.description:
Call status codes.

* 0 indicates a successful call.
* Other values indicate a failed call. You can determine the specific error reason through the msg field.

fields.name: msg
fields.description: Status information. Detailed error information can be viewed through this field when the API call fails.

fields.name: bot_id
fields.description: The ID of the created agent.

http_handlers.name: PublishDraftBot
http_handlers.description: Publish the specified agent to API, Web SDK, or custom channels.

fields.name: bot_id
fields.description:
The ID of the agent to be published.
Navigate to the build page of the agent. The number following the `bot` path parameter in the URL is the agent ID. For example, in the URL `https://www.coze.com/space/341****/bot/73428668*****`, the agent ID is `73428668*****`.

fields.name: connector_ids
fields.description:
List of IDs of the channels to which the agent is published. Currently, this API supports publishing agents as API, Web SDK, and custom channels.

* Agent as API: 1024
* Web SDK: 999
* Custom channel: Custom channel ID. For information about how to obtain the channel ID, see [Channel integration overview](https://www.coze.com/docs/guides/channel_integration_overview). Ensure that the access token of the creator using the custom channel is used.

fields.name: code
fields.description:
Status code:

* A value of `0` indicates a successful call.
* Any other value indicates a failed call. You can determine the detailed error reason through the msg field.

fields.name: msg
fields.description: This field provides detailed information about the result of the API call. If the API call fails, `msg` contains a description of the error or the reason for the failure.

types.name: SearchStrategy
types.description:
The search strategy for the knowledge base. Values include:
0: (Default) Semantic search. Understand the relationships between words and sentences like a human does.
1: Hybrid search. Combine the advantages of full-text retrieval and semantic search, and sort the results comprehensively to recall relevant content fragments.
20: Full-text search. Full-text retrieval based on keywords.

fields.description: The persona and response logic of the intelligent agent. Length is 0~20,000 characters. Default is empty.

- **false: call as needed**. The knowledge base is called based on actual needs, using the recalled content to assist in generating replies. In this case, it is necessary to clearly specify in the persona and reply logic area on the left under what circumstances to call which knowledge base to reply.
